name: Maps
description: Detailed navigational charts and geographical maps produced by Venetian cartographers. Essential tools for maritime trade and exploration, and prized by collectors and scholars.

historicalNotes.historicalSignificance: Venetian cartography represented the cutting edge of geographical knowledge in the late medieval and Renaissance periods. The Republic's extensive maritime trade network provided a constant flow of new geographical information, while its position as a crossroads of cultures allowed for the synthesis of different cartographic traditions. Venetian maps were highly prized throughout Europe for their accuracy and detail, particularly their portolan charts for Mediterranean navigation.
